title: Garth Pratten
text:
Garth Pratten (1973) is an Australian historian in the <a href="Strategic%20and%20Defence%20Studies%20Centre">Strategic and Defence Studies Centre</a> at the <a href="Australian%20National%20University">Australian National University</a>.
Garth Pratten has worked for the <a href="Australian%20Army">Australian Army</a>'s Training Command, as an historian at the <a href="Australian%20War%20Memorial">Australian War Memorial</a>, and taught at <a href="Deakin%20University">Deakin University</a>, in the War Studies Department at the <a href="Royal%20Military%20Academy%20Sandhurst">Royal Military Academy Sandhurst</a> and at the Australian National University. In 2010, Pratten deployed to Afghanistan as part of the team compiling the war diary for ISAF's Regional Command South while working for the British Ministry of Defence. Pratten undertook field work in France, Belgium, Libya, Malaya, Singapore, Turkey and Cyprus.
